intro: Aeollanthus goetzei, commonly known as the Goetze's aeollanthus, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, cold environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and faces threats from habitat loss and climate change. Its botanical study is important for understanding plant adaptation in extreme environments.
